thread.title: 'Justice must prevail' Pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw petition launched to get his job back
thread.title_full: 'Justice must prevail' Pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw petition launched to get his job back

title: 'Justice must prevail' Pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw petition launched to get his job back
text:
'Justice must prevail' Pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw petition launched to get his job back 'Justice must prevail' Pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw petition launched to get his job back A PETITION has been launched to get pie-eating Sutton United goalie Wayne Shaw his job back after he resigned over a betting scandal. / Published 22nd February 2017 
The 23-stone stopper was filmed munching on a pie at the sideline during the South London team's clash against Arsenal on Monday. 
But it later emerged that the "roly poly goalkeeper" knew Sun Bets was offering 8/1 odds against him eating a pie on the bench. 
The Football Association and the Gambling Commission both announced plans to investigate whether there was a breach of betting rules. 
Amid the drama Shaw was asked to resign and stepped down from the job just hours after the club’s FA defeat. Wayne Shaw eats a pie during Sutton's defeat to Arsenal Tuesday, 21st February 2017 WAYNE SHAW was snapped eating a pie while on the substitutes' bench for Sutton last night. 1 / 7 BBC 
Now an online campaign has called for the goalie to be reinstated. 
It says: “Sutton United's rotund reserve goalkeeper Wayne Shaw was unjustly sacked for eating a pie in the dugout during his team's FA Cup tie against Arsenal. 
“Justice must prevail and Wayne must be reinstated to the subs' bench.” 
With over 1,500 signatures since it was started last night, the petition will be handed to Sutton United once it reaches the target. 
SUTTON UNITED/GETTY ROLY POLY: The 23-stone goalie is a firm favourite with fans “Justice must prevail and Wayne must be reinstated to the subs' bench” The petition 
Supporters have backed the fan favourite, saying the pie-eating stunt was just a joke taken the wrong way. 
Ryan Cheeseman wrote: "Wayne is the nicest guy I've met and he's Mr Sutton." 
The 46-year-old has been inundated with job offers since his resignation, with supermarket Morrisons and restaurant chain MEATliquor keen to cash in on the goalie’s pie knowledge. 
And the likes of Gary Lineker and Piers Morgan jumped in to defend the keeper's actions on Twitter yesterday. 
But it’s not the first time Shaw has been let go by Sutton United, after Daily Star Online revealed the stopper’s bad boy past. 
BBC STOPPER: Goalie Wayne Shaw admitted he knew there was a bet on him eating a pie See inside Arsenal's dressing room ahead of Sutton clash Monday, 20th February 2017 ARSENAL are facing Sutton in the FA Cup tonight - here's a behind-the-scenes look inside the Gunners dressing room. 1 / 9 Arsenal's dressing room 
He left the team in 2013 after clashing with rival fans before a cup game. 
But the dad-of-two was asked back after a year away before he hit the headlines again during the unprecedented FA cup clash. 
Sutton's chairman Bruce Elliot was not impressed with Shaw. 
Speaking on BBC 5 Live, Sutton's chairman Bruce Elliot said: “If you knew the roly poly goalkeeper you probably wouldn’t be very surprised. But Wayne is a top man. 
“I didn’t know anything about it. He has got himself in the papers again and the fame obviously has gone to his head a little bit, but we will soon bring him back down to earth, don’t worry about that.” Related articles
